item.title: Conditional operation on Pandas Dataframe columns
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Create pandas dataframe data = pd.DataFrame({'Date':['10/2/2020', '11/2/2020', '12/2/2020', '13/2/2020'], 'Product':['Umbrella', 'Matress', 'Badminton', 'Shuttle'], 'Last Price':[1200, 1500, 1600, 352], 'Updated Price':[1300, 1400, 1550, 600], 'Discount':[10, 10, 10, 10]}) # Print the dataframe print(data) Date Product Last Price Updated Price Discount 0 10/2/2020 Umbrella 1200 1300 10 1 11/2/2020 Matress 1500 1400 10 2 12/2/2020 Badminton 1600 1550 10 3 13/2/2020 Shuttle 352 600 10 # Condition - Check if the updated price is available or not if 'Updated Price' in data.

item.title: Creating Pandas Dataframe using list of lists
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Initialize list of lists lst = [['Numpy', 10], ['Pandas', 15], ['Matplotlib', 20]] # Print list of lists print(lst) [['Numpy', 10], ['Pandas', 15], ['Matplotlib', 20]] # Create the pandas DataFrame data = pd.DataFrame(lst, columns = ['Tech', 'Points']) # Print dataframe print(data) Tech Points 0 Numpy 10 1 Pandas 15 2 Matplotlib 20

item.title: Creating a Dataframe from Pandas Series
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Initialize lists values students = ['Steven', 'James', 'Ronald', 'Han'] marks = [90, 95, 65, 73] # Print students list values print(student) ['Steven', 'James', 'Ronald', 'Han'] # Print marks list values print(marks) [90, 95, 65, 73] # Importing Series from Pandas for students list and printing it out students = pd.Series(students) marks = pd.Series(marks) print(students) 0 Steven 1 James 2 Ronald 3 Han dtype: object # Importing Series from Pandas for marks list and printing it out marks = pd.

item.title: Creating a Numpy Array
item.description: # Importing numpy library import numpy as np# Creating a rank 1 Array and printing it out arr = np.array([99, 47, 38]) print("Array with Rank 1: \n",arr) Array with Rank 1: [99 47 38] # Creating a rank 2 Array and printing it out arr = np.array([[11, 27, 35], [46, 52, 64]]) print("Array with Rank 2: \n", arr) Array with Rank 2: [[11 27 35] [46 52 64]] # Creating an array from tuple and printing it out arr = np.

item.title: Creating a Pandas Dataframe using list of dicts
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Initialize list of dicts data = [{'Raghul': 90, 'Ramesh': 85, 'Steven': 70}, {'Raghul': 'O', 'Ramesh': 'A+', 'Steven': 'A'}] # Print list of dicts print(data) [{'Raghul': 90, 'Ramesh': 85, 'Steven': 70}, {'Raghul': 'O', 'Ramesh': 'A+', 'Steven': 'A'}] # Create the pandas DataFrame data = pd.DataFrame(data, index =['Marks', 'Grade']) # Print dataframe print(data) Raghul Ramesh Steven Marks 90 85 70 Grade O A+ A

item.title: Creating a Pandas Dataframe using list of tuples
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Initialize list of tuples lst = [('Numpy', 10), ('Pandas', 15), ('Matplotlib', 20), ('Scikit-Learn', 25)] # Print list of tuples print(lst) [('Numpy', 10), ('Pandas', 15), ('Matplotlib', 20), ('Scikit-Learn', 25)] # Create the pandas DataFrame data = pd.DataFrame(lst, columns = ['Tech', 'Points']) # Print dataframe print(data) Tech Points 0 Numpy 10 1 Pandas 15 2 Matplotlib 20 3 Scikit-Learn 25

item.title: Creating a Pandas Dataframe using string data
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Importing StringIO function from io module from io import StringIO # Wrap the string data in StringIO function and store it in a variable data = StringIO("""Date;Exam;Marks 10/2/2020;Maths;100 11/2/2020;Physics;95 12/2/2020;Chemistry;80 13/2/2020;ComputerScience;85 """) # Read the data using Pandas read_csv() function data = pd.read_csv(data, sep =";") # Print dataframe print(data) Date Exam Marks 0 10/2/2020 Maths 100 1 11/2/2020 Physics 95 2 12/2/2020 Chemistry 80 3 13/2/2020 ComputerScience 85

item.title: Dropping columns of a Pandas Dataframe
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Create pandas dataframe data = pd.DataFrame({'Date':['10/2/2020', '11/2/2020', '12/2/2020', '13/2/2020'], 'Product':['Umbrella', 'Matress', 'Badminton', 'Shuttle'], 'Last Price':[1200, 1500, 1600, 352], 'Updated Price':[1300, 1400, 1550, 600], 'Discount':[10, 10, 10, 10]}) # Print the dataframe print(data) Date Product Last Price Updated Price Discount 0 10/2/2020 Umbrella 1200 1300 10 1 11/2/2020 Matress 1500 1400 10 2 12/2/2020 Badminton 1600 1550 10 3 13/2/2020 Shuttle 352 600 10 # Dropping column of dataframe data = data.

item.title: Getting column names of a Pandas Dataframe
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Initialize list of dicts data = [{'Mark': 90, 'Grade': "O", 'Comments': "Best"}, {'Mark': 75, 'Grade': "A", 'Comments': "Needs to be immproved"}] # Print list of dicts print(data) [{'Mark': 90, 'Grade': 'O', 'Comments': 'Best'}, {'Mark': 75, 'Grade': 'A', 'Comments': 'Needs to be immproved'}] # Create the pandas DataFrame data = pd.DataFrame(data, index =['Stephen', 'Jerry']) # Print dataframe print(data) Mark Grade Comments Stephen 90 O Best Jerry 75 A Needs to be immproved # iterating the columns for col in data.

item.title: Getting unique values from a column in Pandas Dataframe
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Initialize list of dicts data = [{'Mark': 90, 'Grade': "O", 'Comments': "Best"}, {'Mark': 75, 'Grade': "A", 'Comments': "Needs to be immproved"}, {'Mark': 40, 'Grade': "F", 'Comments': "Hard work is essential"}] # Print list of dicts print(data) [{'Mark': 90, 'Grade': 'O', 'Comments': 'Best'}, {'Mark': 75, 'Grade': 'A', 'Comments': 'Needs to be immproved'}, {'Mark': 40, 'Grade': 'F', 'Comments': 'Hard work is essential'}] # Create the pandas DataFrame data = pd.

item.title: Renaming column names of a Pandas Dataframe
item.description: # Import pandas library import pandas as pd# Initialize list of dicts data = [{'Mark': 90, 'Grade': "O", 'Comments': "Best"}, {'Mark': 75, 'Grade': "A", 'Comments': "Needs to be immproved"}] # Print list of dicts print(data) [{'Mark': 90, 'Grade': 'O', 'Comments': 'Best'}, {'Mark': 75, 'Grade': 'A', 'Comments': 'Needs to be immproved'}] # Create the pandas DataFrame data = pd.DataFrame(data, index =['Stephen', 'Jerry']) # Print dataframe print(data) Mark Grade Comments Stephen 90 O Best Jerry 75 A Needs to be immproved # Iterating the column names for col in data.

item.title: Making a Pandas DataFrame with two-dimensional list
item.description: import pandas as pdlst = [['Nicole', 'Williamson', 23], ['William', 'Smith', 29], ['Nick', 'Fury', 30], ['Vin', 'williams', 22]] print(lst) [['Nicole', 'Williamson', 23], ['William', 'Smith', 29], ['Nick', 'Fury', 30], ['Vin', 'williams', 22]] df = pd.DataFrame(lst, columns =['FirstName', 'LastName', 'Age']) print(df) FirstName LastName Age 0 Nicole Williamson 23 1 William Smith 29 2 Nick Fury 30 3 Vin williams 22
